SENT.plain: The association of livedo reticularis and cerebrovascular lesions is known as Sneddon's syndrome
It affects young adults and is more common in females
Repeated strokes lead these patients to residual deficits
Recently, Sneddon's syndrome has been described in a subset of patients with systemic lupus erythematous and primary antiphospholipid syndrome
We report two cases, one of them with antiphospholipid antibodies
Antiphospholipid antibodies do not seem to explain the events of Sneddon's Syndrome
Perhaps, different pathogenic mechanisms play role in the clinical expression of this syndrome
